data.title: Regex look ahead groups fail in workspace search
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:13:11.413Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|erb|CraigMaslowski|0.0.1|
|CreateModule|HookyQR|0.0.5|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.1.1|
|GitHubIssues|HookyQR|0.1.2|
|minify|HookyQR|0.3.0|
|output-colorizer|IBM|0.1.1|
|vscode-devdocs|akfish|1.0.1|
|vscode-icontheme-nomo-dark|be5invis|1.2.6|
|vscode-dash|deerawan|1.5.0|
|devdocs|deibit|0.0.2|
|gitlens|eamodio|3.5.1|
|tslint|eg2|0.12.0|
|LogFileHighlighter|emilast|1.1.1|
|Theme-FlatlandMonokai|gerane|0.0.4|
|monkey-c|ghisguth|0.3.1|
|vscode-ebnf|igochkov|1.0.3|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.0|
|Theme-1337|ms-vscode|0.1.4|
|Theme-MaterialKit|ms-vscode|0.1.4|
|Theme-TomorrowKit|ms-vscode|0.1.4|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.0.1|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.12.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.8.1|
|theme-obsidian|rprouse|0.2.0|
|partial-diff|ryu1kn|0.3.1|
|trailing-spaces|shardulm94|0.2.11|
|addDocComments|stevencl|0.0.8|
|html-preview-vscode|tht13|0.1.1|
|cordova-tools|vsmobile|1.2.7|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.5.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. enter `organisation_(?!id)` in the workspace search box with regex search selected
2. press enter

![screen shot 2017-06-01 at 1 27 44 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14353068/26660795/680b0f3e-46ce-11e7-9e97-16e9b731545a.png)

This regex works fine in the regular (single file) search field.

Also fails for positive look ahead.

data.title: Excessive `TextEditor disposed` console output
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open and close many files
2. View the dev tools console

or
1. Run tests on https://github.com/HookyQR/VSCodeBeautify locally
2. View console output

![screen shot 2017-06-01 at 1 12 51 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14353068/26660469/689bf5d2-46cc-11e7-8249-084dbcdf0ee4.png)

Can we please not have this message show up every time an editor is closed? This should only be presented during run under debug, not in the production version.

If this is being presented because of an extension trying to access a dead TE, can we have the report at lease specify which extension is trigging it so the author can be informed.

data.title: Searching with inline regex backreference only searches open files
data.body:
As far as I can tell, finding in files with a regular expression including a backreference (e.g. `\1`) will **only return results from files that are open**. _This may be by design or due to some limitation I'm not aware of, but I couldn't find anything in the docs._

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 (Version 1703 - Build 10.0.15063)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a text file with the following text: 
    ```
    ABCA
    ABC
    ```
1. Close the file.
1. Run a regex search across files for `(A).*?\1`. _There are no results._
1. Open the file created in step 1.
1. Rerun the search. It matches the first line of the file.

data.title: "Example" entry included in extension recommendation code complete
data.body:
Verification for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12744

**Steps to reproduce**
- open the `extensions.json` in a workspace
- Try completing one of the extension names

**bug**
Notice an entry called `Example` is included in  the list:

![screen shot 2017-05-31 at 5 50 02 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/26659971/c0d38254-4629-11e7-8b8d-c4032a662da8.png)

Completing this results in:

![screen shot 2017-05-31 at 5 53 01 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/26660019/02e5ce9a-462a-11e7-8f73-c76080cd2265.png)

I believe `Example` comes from the schema in `extensionsFileTemplate.ts`

data.title: Mac services not picking up selected text from editor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #1628

**steps to reproduce**
- On a mac, open a text file and try selecting a line of text in the editor
- Run the `create sticky note` service. This is under the `code -> Services` menu or can be triggered with `cmd + shift + y`

**Expected**
The selected text in the editor is opened in a new sticky note

**Actual**
Some other text is opened in the new sticky note. I'm not sure where we are getting it from

data.body:
From #2773

- Press alt+e to enter an accent mark
- Press shift+arrow - the cursor moves two columns, when it should only move one

cc @rebornix

data.title: Enforce a minimum for markdown.preview.fontSize
data.body:
The editor settings for sizes and heights have sane minimums, but the markdown one allows a fontSize of 1.

See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/22433

data.title: Open new file in language mode current active tab
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. New Feature Request

Currently when open new file while editing file, code defaults it to language mode for text file. It would be nice if when you initiate open file command while a tab is active, code will set language mode of the new file to same as current file you were just working in. For example lets say i am currently writing query in sql script file with .sql extension and i hit `Ctrl + N` while tab is focused, code opens new file with "SQL" language mode already set. Or if i have another tab where i am editing json and it is set to JSON language mode, when i hit `Ctrl + N` code will then open new file set to JSON language mode already. You can also provide a setting to enable/disable this feature based on your preference.

data.title: Snippets for header files
data.body:
This is more a feature request than an issue.

The user snippets is really great but it would be nice (I suppose this is unique to c/cpp) if snippets could be applied to header files also.

I have tried manually copying the c.json to h.json but this does not seem to work.

Cheers

data.title: Cannot reattach to mern app after saving file

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Testing #27463

* Linux Ubuntu 16.04 in Parallels, 2 proc, 4gig memory, 128mb graphics memory
* Insiders build
* Settings ensure that I do not have autosave on:

   `"files.autoSave": "off"`

* `launch.json` (note `runtimeExecutable` is set to local `nodemon`):

``` json
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "protocol": "inspector",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/nodemon",
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--inspect=9222"
            ],
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/index.js",
            "port": 9222,
            "restart": true,
            "env": {
                "BABEL_DISABLE_CACHE": "1",
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            },
            "console": "integratedTerminal",
            "internalConsoleOptions": "neverOpen"
        }
    ]
}
``` 

* `F5` to run/debug the app, takes some time for it to start
* Edit `server/dummyData.js` (seems like any edit is fine, I simply added a new `const content4`
* Save `dummyData.js`

   **Result** in terminal (note the `Starting inspector on 127.0.0.1:9222 failed: address already in use`):

``` bash
[nodemon] files triggering change check: server/dummyData.js
[nodemon] matched rule: **/home/parallels/src/mern-starter/server/**/*
[nodemon] changes after filters (before/after): 1/1
[nodemon] restarting due to changes...
[nodemon] server/dummyData.js

[nodemon] starting `node --inspect=9222 index.js`
[nodemon] child pid: 8501
Starting inspector on 127.0.0.1:9222 failed: address already in use
[nodemon] app crashed - waiting for file changes before starting...
cd /home/parallels/src/mern-starter ; env BABEL_DISABLE_CACHE=1 NODE_ENV=development /home/parallels/src/mern-starter/no
de_modules/.bin/nodemon --inspect=9222 index.js
```

Then I get this Error:

Get "Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1...)

data.title: Edge case of #21209
data.body: Verification of #21209. If you have an unsaved tsconfig/jsconfig file and then do #21037 's command to make one, `{ }` gets appended onto the unsaved file. It's an edge case, so maybe it's not that important. What do you think @mjbvz ?

data.title: Fix for console warnings on merge #27584 and compare view #27585.
data.body: merge-conflict edit commands are falsely async. They generated an edit from the editor to work around the supplied TextEditorEdit being ignored if execution was not synchronous. This change creates a sync code path for getting document conflicts, the reality the await aync get document conflicts would unlikely ever be "delayed" and shared between multiple invocations on the command execution path. It'll happen "some time" after initial scanning completes.

data.title: Integrate Hyper and vscode
data.body: https://github.com/zeit/hyper

data.title: Use outlines in high contrast
data.body:
#27580

@aeschli I can't find a way to make the outline show only in high contrast mode. Using `dark: { outline: 'none' }` also hides it for high contras. There doesn't seem to be a separate override for high contrast. Could you take a look?

data.title: suggestion: default to ./node_modules/.bin/nodemon in launch.json
data.body:
Testing #27463

The generated `launch.json` sets the `runtimeExecutable` to `nodemon`.  Press `F5` to debug and it fails because it cannot find `nodemon`.

i suggest to always refer to the local `./node_modules/.bin/nodemon` instead as that has a higher likelihood of being present once `npm install` has been run.

``` json
            "runtimeExecutable": "./node_modules/.bin/nodemon",
```

data.title: Support for VS2017

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
First of all thanks for this great piece of software.

As far as I can tell from the docs (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#build-and-run-from-source) and my failed attempt to build VSCode with only a VS 2017 installation, VSCode needs a genuine VS2015 installation in order to be compiled. 

Am I correct?
And if so, are there any plans to change that in the near future (like in the comming 1-2 months)?

data.title: Theming: debug callstack and breakpoints annotation labels
data.body: Can't find a way to style the background or foreground of the labels displayed on the right side here: Is it possible?

data.title: Always link to plugin's repository if provided
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Latest
- OS Version: Latest

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to any plugin page

If a plugin has a known repository, it should always be shown, both in VScode and on the marketplace. There is often friction trying to find the right repo for a plugin, as there are often many conflicting versions available in VSCode, and finding the one you need to file a bug against can be a challenge.

Make repositories a first class citizen for plugin pages. I guarantee you it will save developer time, and not having it will use up developer time undesirably.

Plugins should *not* link to their own repos in the README. That is not a good solution to this problem.

data.title: vscode is claiming that NPM is not in PATH on Linux, but it _is_ in my PATH
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use VSCode to edit JS code on Linux
2. Get this error: "Could not install typings files for JavaScript language features. Please ensure that NPM is installed and is in your PATH"

`npm` IS in my `PATH`:

```
$ which npm
/usr/local/bin/npm
```

I even symlinked the `npm` binary into `/usr/bin` -- did not help. We really need type intellisense to work in VSCode with JS to help prevent careless mistakes in our code.

data.title: Turn autocomplete off on Mobile device keyboards
data.body:
Avoiding a number of Android IME keyboard issues by turning ``autocomplete`` to off in the textarea.
Mostly useful for the monaco-editor.

data.title: Support multi-line jsdoc annotations
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a javascript file with multi-line type annotations. For example:
https://github.com/google/closure-library/blob/master/closure/goog/dom/animationframe/animationframe.js#L61

Expected result:
VSCode highlights the jsdoc.

Actual Result:
VSCode highlights the jsdoc in red like there's an error.

data.title: Remove the search results when a file that does not belong to workspace is closed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Extracted from #25422

From @bpasero 

I wonder if we should remove a search result once you close the editor. Of course only for files which are not inside the workspace. Once you retrigger the search after closing such a file, the result is not showing up again.
